image.altText: A young man wearing a blue shirt and sunglasses outside the local court

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory’s Director of Public Prosecutions is considering whether to appeal a decision to allow a young fatal hit-and-run driver who bragged to his friends afterwards to avoid jail time.

title.children: DPP considers appeal after fatal hit-run driver's 'shockingly callous' texts

image.altText: Close-up of sliced mango.

props.synopsis: The first crop forecast for the mango season is predicting the Darwin region to produce 2.2 million trays.

title.children: Mango season is here as NT harvest ramps up

image.altText: Woman stands in park with microphone in front of chest

props.synopsis: Australia's richest person, Gina Rinehart, has helped fund Senator Jacinta Nampijinpa Price's crowd-funded defence to a defamation action brought by the head of a Northern Territory land council.

title.children: Gina Rinehart helps fund Jacinta Nampijinpa Price's defamation defence

image.altText: A palawa woman stands facing the camera in front of an artwork

props.synopsis: Forty years ago, the federal government used the constitution to halt construction of the Franklin Dam. Now lawyers want the Albanese government to do the same to keep kids out of jails.

title.children: Experts say jails cause kids 'irreversible trauma'. They want Albanese to act

image.altText: a gate with a cut-out of a man on a horse silhouetted against a sunset.

props.synopsis: One of Australia's largest private landholders expands his vast portfolio of outback stations, buying Murranji in the NT for $44 million plus the value of its cattle.

title.children: Viv Oldfield expands outback cattle empire, buying Murranji for $44m

image.altText: A man leaning over to hug his bull arab dog, who has white fur, staring affectionately at man, with tongue slightly out.

props.synopsis: A Darwin animal shelter has been accused of "unprofessional" behaviour after failing to provide desexing services which new owners had already paid for as part of their adoption fee.

title.children: Pet re-homing charity labelled 'unprofessional' over failure to desex animals

image.altText: A man sits in an office with a pen in his mouth.

props.synopsis: Redford died "at his home in Sundance in the mountains of Utah" surrounded by family, his publicist announced.

title.children: Robert Redford, Oscar-winning Hollywood legend, dies aged 89

image.altText: A close up of Sussan Ley.

props.synopsis: In her first major economic speech, the opposition leader hits out at universal subsidies and says "dependency" has affected Australia's "national character".

title.children: Australians too dependent on government, says Sussan Ley

image.altText: A children's toy bear laying sideways on a floor.

props.synopsis: About 400 educators were issued prohibition orders banning them from early education or care in the past five years, the ABC can reveal.

title.children: Parents kept in the dark over hundreds of blacklisted childcare workers

image.altText: Anthony Albanese in a suit gestures with his hand

props.synopsis: A major defence treaty between Australia and Papua New Guinea has failed to get over the line today, with the countries resorting to signing a communique in lieu of the actual document. Follow live.

title.children: Albanese and PNG PM speak after defence treaty fails at final hurdle

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Breaking: Australia and PNG fail to clinch defence agreement, resorting to communique
Donald Trump takes aim at ABC journalist as he suggests he'll meet Albanese 'very soon'

image.altText: An older man wearing a red tie, white shirt and a black suit jacket with a serious expression

props.synopsis: The US president has been given something no other world leader has ever received: a second state visit invitation from Buckingham Palace. But assessing the trip's success means looking beneath the pomp and pageantry.

title.children: We're about to find out if King Charles holds the key to influencing Trump

image.altText: Houses under construction on a bright, sunny day

props.synopsis: The expansion of the scheme, which allows first home buyers to purchase a property with as little as a 5 per cent deposit, has some warning it will also inflate the market. Here's what you'll need to be earning to get a foot in the door.

title.children: Here's who is eligible for an expanded first home scheme. Hint: it's not many

image.altText: Mid shot of a farmer walking through waist high crop as the sun sets in the background

props.synopsis: Shifting growing seasons, interruptions to supply chains from increased natural disasters and damage to crops and livestock from extreme heat have been identified as key threats to food supply in a warmer climate.

title.children: Report exposes 'extremely concerning' risk to food supply as climate warms

image.altText: Jess Hull bites a medal

props.synopsis: Jess Hull claims bronze in the women's 1,500m at the World Athletics Championships, after Peter Bol was eliminated from the 800m in the heats.

title.children: 'Elated' Hull wins first world championship medal in epic 1,500m

image.altText: Luigi Mangione, a man in his late 20s, walking in a prison jumpsuit, guided by two armed officers.

props.synopsis: The 27-year-old Ivy League graduate still faces New York state second-degree murder charges and a federal death penalty prosecution.

title.children: Judge dismisses terrorism charges against Luigi Mangione

image.altText: A large rock sits upon a monument with wind turbines in the background.

props.synopsis: Rare earths are critical for manufacturing everything from electric vehicles to wind turbines and defence equipment, and with China's dominance over the supply chain, they have also become inextricably enmeshed in geopolitics.

title.children: This $1bn stockpile could be the key to breaking China's grip on rare earths

image.altText: Alan Jones wearing a suit and tie

props.synopsis: Court records confirm the new charges were formally laid against veteran broadcaster Alan Jones on Monday.

title.children: Alan Jones hit with nine new indecent assault charges

image.altText: Customers browse items at David Jones

props.synopsis: Two and a half million Australians have signed up for this cashback app, which leaves them wondering what's next.

title.children: What we know about Cashrewards's abrupt shutdown

image.altText: A white post office.

props.synopsis: A rural Tasmanian community has fought to keep its post office open, fearing losing the important service could lead to their hometown disappearing.

title.children: How a tiny town brought its post office back from the brink of closure

image.altText: Two people sit on the couch looking serious.

props.synopsis: Residents and medical professionals in south-western NSW are pushing to establish a new local health district in Griffith, arguing current services are not good enough.

title.children: Rural doctors can't 'take it anymore', demand that health district splits

image.altText: A man wrapped in a black, yellow and red flag walks down a street with people following him

props.synopsis: The protests nearly doubled in size on Tuesday as people continued to vent their frustrations at a plan to buy MPs 65 new SUVs.

title.children: 'Stop thieves': Timor-Leste protesters vow to keep rallying over MP car plan

image.altText: A woman receives an injection to her face

props.synopsis: New rules have come into place aimed at better protecting patients from unsafe cosmetic procedures. Here's what it mean for your next appointment.

title.children: New rules for Botox and fillers are here. Here's what it means for you

image.altText: Donald Trump smiles while standing at a podium.

props.synopsis: In a lengthy post on his social media platform, the US president accused The New York Times of lying about him, his family and his business.

title.children: Trump files $US15 billion lawsuit against The New York Times

image.altText: The exterior of a court house.

props.synopsis: During her unpaid placement at a not-for-profit community legal centre in Sydney, Dani struggled to make ends meet. She is among some law students whose entry into the profession is fraught with financial difficulty.

title.children: Unpaid placements a 'significant barrier' for struggling law students

image.altText: A black and white photograph of a group of smiling young women in the mid-20th century, a ship's rigging in the background

props.synopsis: Signorinella: Little Miss, the new documentary from the filmmakers behind Lygon St — Si Parla Italiano, celebrates the tenacity of Italian Australian women in business and beyond.

title.children: Meet the Italian women who helped build modern Australia

image.altText: A multi-storey building sits burnt-out after a large fire

props.synopsis: As clean-up efforts continue and an interim government finds its feet, families have said farewell to loved ones killed in last week's violence.

title.children: Nepal counts the personal and financial cost of deadly riots

image.altText: Soldier flood waters

props.synopsis: A dedicated disaster recovery force is needed, or else responders and defence forces could be "overwhelmed" by multiple concurrent natural disasters, the National Climate Risk Assessment warns.

title.children: Dedicated disaster force needed to prevent ADF being overwhelmed: report

image.altText: A man steps onto a bus that says it is Laverton-bound.

props.synopsis: Victoria is spending the least per capita on its urban bus system of any state, leaving some Melbourne residents in the lurch at their local bus stop.

title.children: Ignored reforms keeping buses an 'ugly duckling' in Melbourne

image.altText: Jacinta Allan gets a selfie with delegation in China

props.synopsis: Jacinta Allan's one week trip to the Middle Kingdom is a show with two audiences, as she eyes Chinese investment and hopes to solidify her party's relationship with Chinese Victorians.

title.children: The Victorian premier's trip to China hopes to generate selfies and trade

image.altText: A greyscale satellite image of a boat moving in dark waters, surrounded by green and blue 'UNCLASSIFIED' markings

props.synopsis: Donald Trump is using the US military to bomb boats suspected of carrying drugs in international waters. But little is known about who is being killed, and military and legal experts are raising several red flags.

title.children: Trump's deadly 'war' with cartels could backfire in several ways, experts say

image.altText: Stock image of a Virgin plane

props.synopsis: Mother-of-two Elise Turner says she was asked to leave the Virgin Australia business lounge after refusing to go to a bathroom to pump breast milk.

title.children: Virgin Australia apologises after breastfeeding mum ejected from lounge

image.altText: A white and green China Coast Guard ship sails through calm blue seas.

props.synopsis: China's coastguard has accused Philippine ships of illegally entering China's territorial waters at a shoal that is internationally recognised as within the Philippines' exclusive economic zone.

title.children: Chinese vessels clash with Philippine boats at disputed shoal

image.altText: Gas leak at Sydney restaurant 2025-09-16 10:09:00

props.synopsis: One person has died and several others, including police officers, are receiving medical treatment after a gas leak at a restaurant in north-west Sydney.

title.children: One dead, seven hospitalised after gas leak at Sydney restaurant

image.altText: A close up of a man with curly hair and a stubbly beard, looking off-camera.

props.synopsis: Less than a week ago, Craig McLachlan was announced to play Colonel Mustard in the forthcoming national tour, making his return to the theatre after The Rocky Horror Show.

title.children: Craig McLachlan drops out of Cluedo stage show following backlash

image.altText: A man sits on the side of a garden bed in front of a mural depicting the Union Jack.

props.synopsis: On the foreshore of Papua New Guinea's capital city, Ela Beach is where locals come to exercise, mingle and unwind at the end of a long day. But it wasn't always this way.

title.children: Papua New Guineans on the state of the nation amid anniversary celebrations
